name: RNAseq-Pipeline
description: RNA-seq analysis using DESeq2, STAR, Salmon, GSEA.

steps: Quality control with FastQC and MultiQC
Alignment with STAR or quantification with Salmon
Transcript quantification and count matrix generation
Differential expression with DESeq2
Pathway enrichment (GSEA, ORA)

name: Methylation-Pipeline
description: EPIC array normalization and DMP analysis.

steps: Preprocessing of IDATs
Probe filtering and QC
Normalization (BMIQ / SWAN)
Differential methylation with limma
Pathway enrichment

name: HiPlex Demultiplexer
description: A scalable and efficient pipeline for preprocessing, demultiplexing, and downstream analysis of high-throughput multiplexed Cut&Tag data targeting multiple histone marks or transcription factors

steps: Sample-level Demultiplexing: Based on standard i7 and i5 Illumina dual indices to separate libraries from different samples.
Antibody-level Demultiplexing: Performed using barcodes at both 5′ and 3′ ends that identify the target-specific antibodies.

name: ATAC-Seq
description: Pipeline for preprocessing and downstream analysis of ATAC-seq data from raw reads to peak annotation and visualization

steps: Mapping genome-wide chromatin accessibility
Identifying enhancers, promoters, and regulatory elements
Inferring transcription factor binding via footprinting
Studying dynamic chromatin remodeling across conditions
Integration with RNA-seq and ChIP-seq for regulatory network analysis

name: Chip-Seq
description: pipeline is designed for comprehensive analysis of ChIP-seq data, covering preprocessing, alignment, peak calling, annotation, and differential binding analysis

steps: Profiling of transcription factor binding sites
Histone modification landscape analysis
Differential binding across conditions
Chromatin state mapping

name: CutnTag
description: pipeline provides a complete workflow for processing and analyzing Cleavage Under Targets and Tagmentation (Cut&Tag) data

steps: Histone mark profiling (e.g., H3K27ac, H3K4me3, H3K27me3)
Transcription factor binding analysis with low cell numbers
Epigenomic landscape profiling in primary tissues or rare cell populations
Single-cell chromatin profiling (in modified implementations)

name: CutnTag
description: pipeline provides a complete workflow for processing and analyzing Cleavage Under Targets and Tagmentation (Cut&Tag) data

steps: Histone mark profiling (e.g., H3K27ac, H3K4me3, H3K27me3)
Transcription factor binding analysis with low cell numbers
Epigenomic landscape profiling in primary tissues or rare cell populations
Single-cell chromatin profiling (in modified implementations)

name: Single Cell Omics
description: pipeline provides modular and scalable pipelines for single-cell omics technologies, including scRNA-seq, CITE-seq, TCR-seq, and BCR-seq

steps: scRNA-seq: Transcriptome-wide gene expression profiling at single-cell resolution
CITE-seq: Simultaneous quantification of transcriptome and surface protein abundance using antibody-derived tags (ADTs)
TCR-seq: T-cell receptor profiling to track clonality and immune repertoire diversity
BCR-seq: B-cell receptor sequencing for clonal expansion and somatic hypermutation analysis

name: Whole Genome Bisulfite Sequencing (WGBS)
description: A pipeline for preprocessing and differential analysis of methylation data from Whole Genome Bisulfite Sequencing (WGBS)

steps: Single-base resolution of methylation at CpG and non-CpG sites (CHG, CHH)
Unbiased genome-wide coverage, including promoters, enhancers, and intergenic regions
Compatible with low-input and FFPE DNA (via optimized library prep)
Supports allele-specific methylation and imprinted gene analysis

name: WGS/WES Variant Calling Pipeline
description: A comprehensive pipeline for variant discovery using Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS) and Whole Exome Sequencing (WES) data, supporting both germline and somatic variant calling workflows, with or without matched normal samples.

steps: Germline: Single or multi-sample variant calling using HaplotypeCaller in GVCF mode
Somatic (Tumor/Normal): Matched tumor-normal pairs using Mutect2
Somatic (Tumor-only): Tumor-only mode with panel of normals and population allele frequency filtering
